full_text: Page 1104 Fwd: Media inquiry - TMZ - seeking autopsy results of Jeffrey Epstein From [b(6); (b)(7)(C)] To [b(6); (b)(7)(C)] Date 2019/08/16 18:57 Subject: Fwd: Media inquiry - TMZ - seeking autopsy results of Jeffrey Epstein Attachments: TEXT.htm Sent from my Verizon, Samsung Galaxy smartphone -------- Original message -------- From: [b(6); (b)(7)(C)] @bop.gov> Date: 8/16/19 5:45 PM (GMT-05:00) To: BOP-IPP/PublicAffairs@bop.gov [b(6); (b)(7)(C)] @bop.gov> Subject: Re: Media inquiry - TMZ - seeking autopsy results of Jeffrey Epstein >>> [b(6); (b)(7)(C)] 08/16/2019 17:45 >>> [b(6); ... hold off on this - no need to respond... I have given [b(6); guidance....we'll handle it.. thanks [b(6); (b)(7)(C)] Chief, Office of Public Affairs Federal Bureau of Prisons U.S. Department of Justice 202-514-6551 >>> BOP-IPP/Public Affairs 8/16/2019 5:34 PM >>> [b(6); I'm curious if you can review this inquiry from TMZ & whether the region/MCC can confirm my general understanding that the BOP does not get autopsies [b(6); has not reviewed any of this. Definitely do NOT respond to any reporters on this. I'm just outlining a rough draft answer which [b(6); will need to TMZ's Question: Do you have the results of his autopsy? Proposed Response: [b(6); Proposed response for other reporters tonight or tomorrow who may ask the question in different ways such as whether we normally get autopsies or expec [b(6); Office of Public Affairs Information, Policy and Public Affairs Division Federal Bureau of Prisons (202) 514-6551 - phone (202) 514-6620 - fax >>> [b(6); (b)(7)(C)] (*IC)"[b(6); (b)(7)(C)] @tmz.com> 8/16/2019 5:05 PM >>> Do you have the results of his autopsy? Page 2790 DOJ-OGR-00025326

text_blocks.content: Page 1104 Fwd: Media inquiry - TMZ - seeking autopsy results of Jeffrey Epstein From [b(6); (b)(7)(C)] To [b(6); (b)(7)(C)] Date 2019/08/16 18:57 Subject: Fwd: Media inquiry - TMZ - seeking autopsy results of Jeffrey Epstein Attachments: TEXT.htm

Sent from my Verizon, Samsung Galaxy smartphone -------- Original message -------- From: [b(6); (b)(7)(C)] @bop.gov> Date: 8/16/19 5:45 PM (GMT-05:00) To: BOP-IPP/PublicAffairs@bop.gov [b(6); (b)(7)(C)] @bop.gov> Subject: Re: Media inquiry - TMZ - seeking autopsy results of Jeffrey Epstein

>>> [b(6); (b)(7)(C)] 08/16/2019 17:45 >>> [b(6); ... hold off on this - no need to respond... I have given [b(6); guidance....we'll handle it.. thanks [b(6); (b)(7)(C)] Chief, Office of Public Affairs Federal Bureau of Prisons U.S. Department of Justice 202-514-6551

>>> BOP-IPP/Public Affairs 8/16/2019 5:34 PM >>> [b(6); I'm curious if you can review this inquiry from TMZ & whether the region/MCC can confirm my general understanding that the BOP does not get autopsies [b(6); has not reviewed any of this. Definitely do NOT respond to any reporters on this. I'm just outlining a rough draft answer which [b(6); will need to
TMZ's Question: Do you have the results of his autopsy? Proposed Response: [b(6);
Proposed response for other reporters tonight or tomorrow who may ask the question in different ways such as whether we normally get autopsies or expec [b(6);
Office of Public Affairs Information, Policy and Public Affairs Division Federal Bureau of Prisons (202) 514-6551 - phone (202) 514-6620 - fax
>>> [b(6); (b)(7)(C)] (*IC)"[b(6); (b)(7)(C)] @tmz.com> 8/16/2019 5:05 PM >>> Do you have the results of his autopsy?

additional_notes: The document is an email chain discussing a media inquiry from TMZ regarding the autopsy results of Jeffrey Epstein. The email contains redactions of personal information.
